Interview Descriptions: I received a phone screening one month after applying online. The phone screening was great. There was just a few questions asking about my previous experience in customer service and we also went over my resume. After the phone screening I was offered a in person interview, which I accepted. The in person interview was different than any interview I have ever had. It was comfortable but also intense! Questions ranging from my own personal life to my professional life.
Interview Questions: The most difficult question that came up was not a question at all. It was role playing!

title: High School Recruiter Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Chamberlain University (Atlanta, GA) in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions:
I went through three interviews. The first was with the national guy out of Florida. I was applying for a position in Atlanta. It took about 3 weeks and I got a call for the local interview. Interviewed with the hiring manager locally at the new Atlanta location in Dunwoody. Then I was referred to the national recruiting manager to meet with him. I was able to do an interview in person as he was in the office and not traveling or out of town at that time. Each interview was about an hour. 

Unfortunately, DeVry is known for not calling people back or informing them of their decision. At the time, I was told I was the only one interviewing for the position. However, when it came time for a decision, I was given no word...

I ended up withdrawing my name from candidacy as I felt I wasn't going to be offered the job anyway. I followed up with both the local and national recruiting managers with one phone call and then one email each. After a month of no contact, I sent a well-wishes email and that was that.
Interview Questions: Standard questions. Nothing too difficult.

title: Associate Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Chamberlain University (Dayton, OH) in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions: It was conducted by telephone and seem very complete.  There was also verification of licenses and drug screening that had to be performed.  The interview process was fairly smooth and the person who conducted the interview was pleasant and know threatening.
Interview Questions: Why I liked teaching

title: Admissions Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Chamberlain University in Jun 2012
Interview Descriptions: Included a phone screening.  Before meeting on location I was sent personality tests and IQ tests.  Then I met with the Director and the team the same day.  Afterwards I was required to do a drug screening, at their expense.  I got a call the same day and was offered the job.  I believe they had a high need for the position and my experience and personality happened to meet their needs exactly.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Full Time Faculty Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Chamberlain University (Chicago, IL) in Feb 2012
Interview Descriptions: First round interview with HR and then move on to campus interview with leadership on the campus. Then I had to do a demo in front of the faculty and be interviewed by the members of the faculty. I had a bit of a lag time between my first and second interview. Everyone was nice and professional.
Interview Questions: Asked about conflicts and how did I deal with them.

title: Admissions Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Chamberlain University (Addison, IL) in May 2011
Interview Descriptions: Received a call from Human Resources, had a brief interviewed over the phone with recruiter. Really informational about the position. A couple of days later received invite for interview with both Assistant director of admissions and the director of admissions. Interview was very standard. Not too many difficult questions. Helps if you read about the requirements of the position, and have experience on over the phone sales.
Interview Questions: Do you hate losing, or do you love winning?

title: Enrollment Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Chamberlain University (Chicago, IL) in May 2009
Interview Descriptions: Interview process may include a phone interview with a member of the HR staff. Next, a 1 on 1 interview with a Team Lead and the Dept Manager.  They will ask you to "Tell us a time when..." type of questions.  You do need to complete a personality test.
Interview Questions: "Tell us a time when..." type of questions.
